results.title: The Pawnshop
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Features Charlie Chaplin as the handyman in the pawnshop, and his girlfriend, the shopowner’s daughter. Shows Charlie as a combination janitor and clerk who gets involved in comic rivalry with another clerk, causing confusion with customers and turning hero in a robbery. Note: musical sound effects only.

results.title: Oral language development: views of five teachers
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Louise Henry, Channel 54, KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.) and Veriation Films
results.brief_description: Suggests methods for improving or maintaining the quality of reading programs. Depicts teachers working with children in an environment which provides maximum opportunity for oral language exposure and interaction. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: The Mole and the TV
results.brief_description: An animated story about a mole who breaks the television aerial in order to keep the gardener from hearing a television program discussing the need to exterminate moles.

results.title: Vectoria
results.brief_description: Presents a story about a skilled pinball player and his experiences with an unusual pinball machine which demonstraters the four dimensions - position, two-dimensional motion, three-dimensional motion, and time. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
